Cast: Riz Ahmed, Ali Arsher, Nigel Lindsay, Kayvan Novak, Adeel Akhtar, Benedict Cumberbatch, Julia Davis, Craig Parkinson, Preeya Kalidas, Wasim Zakir, Mohammad Aqil 


Synopsis: 
In a British town, four men have a secret plan. Omar (Riz Ahmed) is disappointed with the treatment meted out to Muslims in the world and is determined to become a soldier. This is more exciting than the idea Waj (Kayvan Novak) had ever heard. Better yet, it's silly because Omar is kept that idea to him. Opposite Omar and every living creature is the white Western convert to Islam, Barry (Nigel Lindsay), who would have realized that he had joined the cell to channel their nihilism if I had half a duck-self . Faisal (Adell Akhtar) is the man that hurts. You can make a bomb, but can not be flown at that time because his ailing father "has begun to eat the newspapers." In contrast, aims to train crows to introduce bombs through the windows. This is what Omar has to handle. They have to deal a decisive blow in its own garden, but can any of them strike a match without being in your face? 

Production notes: 
- 2011 Bafta for Best British New Talent for Chris Morris, director and screenwriter. 
- Sundance Film Festival 2010
